title: (x) "Pierre Huyghe" rounded sans - custom face from Tate Gallery {Carlos Duarte Constantino}
content:
I need to a work.

Thanks

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [unknown.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20070320133529/http:/typophile.com/files/unknown_2.jpg) | 53.51 KB |
author: Coca

comments.content:
It looks like the custom version of Gotham that was designed for Print Magazine.

- Mike Yanega

Even though its letterforms are flatter, [Sys](http://web.archive.org/web/20070320133529/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/fsd/sys/) has the most similar structure, in terms of letters like the C, g, y and t. Hoefler’s [Gotham Rounded](http://web.archive.org/web/20070320133529/http:/www.typography.com/catalog/gothamrounded/index.html) has more structural differences, but I am not sure if it has many differences from the custom version for Print magazine.

- Mike Yanega
I don’t think this is from Print. Can you tell us where you found it, Coca?

It’s [Inspira](http://web.archive.org/web/20070320133529/http:/en.wikipedia.org/wiki/GE_Inspira). Not available for licensing. You might like one of these other [rounded fonts](http://web.archive.org/web/20070320133529/http:/www.fontshop.com/virtual/newsletters/mar2006_b/).
Ahh. It’s the custom Tate face that we’ve covered here many times. I’m ashamed.
